item.title: Fuck you cops! fuck you
item.dc:creator: @Ix_Soulcist_xI Soulcist
item.description:
@Ix_Soulcist_xI wrote:

[quote=“m1lkman, post:65, topic:396648”]No. Cripples don’t feel the pain a non crippled person would. So you really need to be more careful with a non-crippled person. Cripples have a higher chance of breaking something, but it’s not like they use their legs anyways.

If you have a [size=12pt]real[/size] problem with the cops. Become a lawyer and stand up for those who have been mistreated. Don’t whine and complain about it on some random programming site trying to start a revolution.[/quote]

Read full topic

item.title: Fuck you cops! fuck you
item.dc:creator: @The_Reaper_X The Reaper X
item.description:
@The_Reaper_X wrote:

If the man is homeless how does he own such a costly wheelchair… Also, did you notice he hit one of the cops in the face on the left? It all looks immoral, but we don’t even know why the cops started in the first place.

item.title: Fuck you cops! fuck you
item.dc:creator: @MistaBigBoss MistaBigBoss
item.description:
@MistaBigBoss wrote:

[quote=“m1lkman, post:65, topic:396648”][quote author=MistaBigBoss link=topic=493818.msg3613544#msg3613544 date=1306795290]

Cres, I don’t understand the logic behind your post. If a person is crippled, the chances of them getting a hurt leg is 100% less likely (because they don’t feel their legs at all) than someone who isn’t crippled.
[/quote]That’s the biggest boolshit I have heard since a while, you need to be MORE carefull with a crippled person because you don’t want to do more damage than already done. It doesn’t matter if one feels pain or not, in the end pain is only nerve signals. Breaking a leg is the same for both crippled and non-crippled people. Really? WHAT THE FUCK. People, I don’t know about you but it’s time to do something about this stuff. Don’t let them fucking control your lives. I don’t know what but do something, start a protest or so and ask to give police officers certain prohibitions. Do fucking something.

No. Cripples don’t feel the pain a non crippled person would. So you really need to be more careful with a non-crippled person. Cripples have a higher chance of breaking something, but it’s not like they use their legs anyways.

If you have a [size=12pt]real[/size] problem with the cops. Become a lawyer and stand up for those who have been mistreated. Don’t whine and complain about it on some random programming site trying to start a revolution.[/quote]You just owned me there.

Read full topic

item.title: Fuck you cops! fuck you
item.dc:creator: @m1lkman m1lkman
item.description:
@m1lkman wrote:

[quote=“MistaBigBoss, post:62, topic:396648”][quote author=m1lkman link=topic=493818.msg3613503#msg3613503 date=1306793489]
Cres, I don’t understand the logic behind your post. If a person is crippled, the chances of them getting a hurt leg is 100% less likely (because they don’t feel their legs at all) than someone who isn’t crippled.
[/quote]That’s the biggest boolshit I have heard since a while, you need to be MORE carefull with a crippled person because you don’t want to do more damage than already done. It doesn’t matter if one feels pain or not, in the end pain is only nerve signals. Breaking a leg is the same for both crippled and non-crippled people. Really? WHAT THE FUCK. People, I don’t know about you but it’s time to do something about this stuff. Don’t let them fucking control your lives. I don’t know what but do something, start a protest or so and ask to give police officers certain prohibitions. Do fucking something.[/quote]

No. Cripples don’t feel the pain a non crippled person would. So you really need to be more careful with a non-crippled person. Cripples have a higher chance of breaking something, but it’s not like they use their legs anyways.

If you have a [size=12pt]real[/size] problem with the cops. Become a lawyer and stand up for those who have been mistreated. Don’t whine and complain about it on some random programming site trying to start a revolution.

Read full topic

item.title: Fuck you cops! fuck you
item.dc:creator: @MistaBigBoss MistaBigBoss
item.description:
@MistaBigBoss wrote:

[quote=“m1lkman, post:61, topic:396648”]Cres, I don’t understand the logic behind your post. If a person is crippled, the chances of them getting a hurt leg is 100% less likely (because they don’t feel their legs at all) than someone who isn’t crippled.[/quote]That’s the biggest boolshit I have heard since a while, you need to be MORE carefull with a crippled person because you don’t want to do more damage than already done. It doesn’t matter if one feels pain or not, in the end pain is only nerve signals. Breaking a leg is the same for both crippled and non-crippled people. Jeezus, also that video, what the fuck, public dancing? Really? WHAT THE FUCK. People, I don’t know about you but it’s time to do something about this stuff. Don’t let them fucking control your lives. I don’t know what but do something, start a protest or so and ask to give police officers certain prohibitions. Do fucking something.

item.title: Fuck you cops! fuck you
item.dc:creator: @Cres Cres
item.description:
@Cres wrote:

[quote=“Jc22493, post:58, topic:396648”][quote author=Cres link=topic=493818.msg3612916#msg3612916 date=1306735529]

Even if he was a terrorist they could’ve atleast handle it a bit more humane because of the fact WHAT IF, he was not the guy.

There are many what ifs in this situation…

what if he was terrorist pretending to be crippled?
what if he was a crippled terrorist,
what if he was a pedophile pretending to be crippled?
what if he was a crippled pedophile?
…

We can’t really give any opinions on this as we dn’t know the whole story.
[/quote]
so if someone is a pedophile we can throw them to the floor rather than arrest them humanely, correct?[/quote]

Not really what i said…
I meant that you should be ( a little bit ) more humane towards an actual crippled person ( performing a theft of any kind ) then towards a person pretending to be crippled.
Either way ( crippled or pretending ) , the police didn’t have the right to violate him like that.

Read full topic

item.title: Fuck you cops! fuck you
item.dc:creator: @Cres Cres
item.description:
@Cres wrote:

[quote=“MistaBigBoss, post:56, topic:396648”][quote author=CoonHunter link=topic=493818.msg3613081#msg3613081 date=1306765111]

yeah, and what if he was a terrorist pretending to be crippled? im sorry but you dont know the situation so dont assume anything not given. the cops were not ordinary donut eating douche bag cops, they looked like fbi or cia or swat, so i dont think they would be doing this for fun. perhaps it was an innocent man being abused, but i do not know that so i will not assume it.

Haha you fucking kidding me, you must be one of those guys who say all Muslims are terrorists as well ie. uneducated retards who should read a book. They have no right to fucking attack that man unless they see anything dangerous (and from what you see in the video the only danger is of the man lighting a cigarette and throwing it on the petrol). That man should have been considered innocent until proven guilty which apparently a lot of cops fail to understand (interrogation techniques etc).

You still have no idea if anything was done before the recording. He could of had a knife pulled at one point (I personally have a balisong with a 5 inch blade that easily fits in my pocket undetectable, for my motorcycle riding). Don’t try to justify that the cops or him were at fualt until you know the entire story.
[/quote]I don’t give a shit if he was a terrorist or not, this is not the FIRST time something like this happend. I know for sure that you know some cases of unnecessary cop violence hence why I’m asuming this might be one of them.[/quote]

Well , one day the cops had shut down a party i was at and kind of took like half of the people to the police station for interrogation only because 1 person had some weed with him.
Worst part is that none of those people had been interrogated ; they just kept 'em there for the whole night…

Read full topic

item.title: Fuck you cops! fuck you
item.dc:creator: @Loveandpower Loveandpower
item.description:
@Loveandpower wrote:

[quote=“the elve age, post:48, topic:396648”][quote author=Loveandpower link=topic=493818.msg3610680#msg3610680 date=1306556011]

[quote author=CoonHunter link=topic=493818.msg3610669#msg3610669 date=1306555374]

By law, a person who is not under arrest cannot be put into handcuffs.

The whole entire " this is for both of our safety" saying is a bunch of bull crap that police have created. In reality, you can actually argue this in court.

Patriot act
[/quote]Show me where it says that police have the right to arrest without reason. I was always under the impression the Patriot Act declared that actions could be used when there was high suspicion. A man in a wheelchair would not count for that I see people in wheelchairs all the time.

You can legally be held (not arrested) in jail for 2 days. Its a simple mis-understanding because when you are taken in to be held, you are still put into handcuffs. A local here had 2 tazer guns on him, and walked towards the police (inb4bullshit or rubber soles). He was held in jail for 2 days to “sober” up.
[/quote]Again, that is with suspicion or with enough evidence that something is occurring. An officer can smell alcohol on a persons breath.

Another common example of the 48 hour rule is when you are the primary suspect in a crime.

They can hold you there for 48 hours without shit against you.[/quote]Only if you let them…they try to play fast hands and not mention what the law states.

And @MBB they get a fairly good bit of training actually. My friend who is recently graduated in my class as one he had to take like three different courses on it.

@ravens discussion is more about police brutality and how much shit they get rid of then what did the man do, we all know we never know what could had been going on.

Read full topic
